byline.contributor: Carson Vaughan contributed reporting from Omaha.

abstract: Nebraskan Legislature votes 30-19 to abolish the death penalty, overriding veto by Republican Gov Pete Ricketts; Nebraska becomes first conservative state in more than 40 years to do away with capital punishment; vote, which follows hours of emotional speeches and cuts across party lines, marks a victory by death penalty opponents who were able to build coalition by winning support of conservatives who believed practice was inefficient, expensive or immoral.
lead_paragraph: Nebraska became the first conservative state in 40 years to ban the death penalty after legislators voted to override the governor’s veto.

headline.main: Nebraska Bans Death Penalty, Defying a Veto
headline.print_headline: Nebraska Bans Death Penalty, Defying a Veto

snippet: Nebraska became the first conservative state in 40 years to ban the death penalty after legislators voted to override the governor’s veto.
